channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Onions and peelings scattered on pavement, 9th February
item.description:
For over a week now there is a section of pavement outside numbers 36-40 Walden road Chislehurst scattered with large onions and peelings. These are unpleasant and you have to step into road traffic to avoid walking them into your shoes. Onions are also highly toxic and dangerous for dogs, so dog walkers must avoid. Not sure how the onions got there, if they were in a recycle bin or food delivery??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walden Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter all down Charlton Church Lane, 9th February
item.description:
The whole street needs a really good clean up. Itâ€™s highly trafficked and especially after football games it gets bad. Ask Charlton FC to help?

item.title: Temporary traffic lights but no work happening, 9th February
item.description:
These lights have been in place for past 2 weeks with no work being done. Thames water are now doing work on Honor Oak Park and its causing huge queues. When will Conway be back to remove lights or do more work???
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Park, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Posts along grass verge all knocked over, 9th February
item.description:
There have been several accidents at this busy junction and now all the posts, at least 5 have been knocked over. There is also debris after the latest accident. Photo is of the Hayes Lane verge just after the junction with Shortlands road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car Parking, 9th February
item.description:
Every Saturday we have a car parking with all 4 wheels on the pavement at the top of Risedale by the junction of Brantwwod Road for the driver to pick up their child from a club held in the Church Hall in Risedale there is plenty of Street parking and this blocks the pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Risedale Road, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
